title: ICE: Region parameter out of range when substituting in region

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
ICE: librustc/ty/subst.rs:424: Region parameter out of range when substituting in region 'a (root type=None) (index=2)

Started getting an ICE on nightly linux builds in travis for [my crate](https://github.com/ipetkov/conch-runtime) while building various integration tests (I've seen builds fail on different integration tests each time). The ICE has reliably occurred on travis during each restart, however, I've been unable to reproduce it locally via travis docker image (so I can't even begin to attempt to minify my source to something that triggers the error). As far as I can tell, this started with rustc 1.24.0-nightly (8e7a609e6 2018-01-04).

Sample build log can be found [here](https://gist.github.com/ipetkov/d82454cffcdb594955d987aec4465bd2).

Happy to provide more logs build info as needed!

## Meta

rustc 1.25.0-nightly (61452e506 2018-01-09)

Backtrace:
